title: Atea earns new ranking among world's most sustainable companies — TradingView News
text: Atea earns new ranking among world's most sustainable companies OSLO -Atea today announced it has earned prestigious recognition as one of the"World's Most Sustainable Companies 2024," based on a new ranking by globalmedia brand TIME (https://time.com), and StatistaR (https://r.statista.com/en/), a world leader in top lists produced viamarketresearch and data analysis. This endeavour is a first-time partnership betweenthe two groups: selecting from over 5,000 companies the top 500 for thisimportant recognition. Each firm is preliminarily assessed on revenue, market capitalization andpublicprominence, and then undergoes a rigorous four-step process involving over 20key data points, including: CDP score, alignment with GRI and SASB, as well asemissions and energy intensity. The winning companies are based in more than 30 countries: most of which areheadquartered in the US (111), followed by Japan (44) and the UK (35). Atea's CEO, Steinar Sønsteby, welcomed this new recognition: "Year after year,we work hard to deliver on our mission as "The Place to Be" for our customers,employees and partners. Our sustainability efforts are an integral part ofthatwork. As a proudly Scandinavian company, we are especially honored to have ourefforts in this area recognized as being among the world's best. This rankingand the selection process sets a benchmark for others to follow." OTHER ACHIEVEMENTS: · In 2024, for the third consecutive year, Atea was ranked one of theworld'stop-100 most sustainable companies by the well-respected research and mediacompany Corporate Knights. · Atea was recently recognized for leadership in corporate transparency andperformance on climate change by global environmental non-profit CDP, earningaplace on its annual "A List." · For the fifth consecutive year, Atea has earned platinum rating onenvironmental and social performance by EcoVadis, placing Atea among the top1%of more than 130,000 companies evaluated. For more information:Robert Giori, CFO Atea ASA, mobile +47 934 09 188Andreas Antonsen, Director of Corporate Responsibility, mobile +46 722 44 8784 About AteaAtea is the leading supplier of IT infrastructure in the Nordic and Balticregions. Atea is present in 88 cities with over 8,000 employees in Norway,Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia. Atea delivershardwareand software from leading global vendors and provides consulting and technicalservices to support its customers with the design, implementation andoperationof their IT environments. Atea had revenue of approximately NOK 35 billion(EUR3.1 billion) in 2023 and is listed on Oslo Stock Exchange. https://www.atea.com. https://newsweb.oslobors.no/message/623111
